timeline.bodyText:
AFAIU the postgrest-config is not very org-specific, although it might be good to have the ability for org-specific tweaks..
However, i juggest to rather filter for inArray(I_S_PostgREST_Config.COLUMNNAME_AD_Org_ID, orgId, OrgID.ANY) (the filter method's real name is different) and then sort by AD_Org_ID descending
timeline.author: metas-ts

timeline.bodyText:
i'm not sure its great to send the whole stacktrace or if that's too much..
but on the other hand, here i think at least the exception class and message should be shown..and maybe, also the whole stacktrace after all (check e.g. the olcand-record).
timeline.author: metas-ts

timeline.bodyText: if it should never happen, i suggest you throw an exception or do Check.fail(...)
timeline.author: metas-ts

timeline.bodyText: might turn out that we also need the type (integer, date, date+time, string) amd ColumnName in this class
timeline.author: metas-ts

+import lombok.Value;
+
+@Value

+@JsonIgnoreProperties(ignoreUnknown = true)

+public class JSONProcessParamBasicInfo

+	String name;
+
+	@JsonProperty("description")
+	String description;

timeline.bodyText: pls move this class to a more "generic" module&package..or if that's not feasilbe, another possibility might be to create one for jasper and one for postgrest and write comments to mae sure future devs don't change them to interfere with each other
timeline.author: metas-ts
